Detailed Description

===========================================================================

Function Documentation

int32_t CSL_patAckIntr ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg,
uint32_t  intrSrc 
)

============================================================================
CSL_patAckIntr

Description
This function is used to acknowledge the specified interrupt source.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure
intrSrc - The interrupt source of type CSL_PatIntrSrc

Return Value
0 - Success
-1 - The specified interrupt source is invalid

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
EOI_REG

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };

    CSL_patAckExceptionInt(&patCfg, CSL_PAT_INTR_SRC_EXCEPTION);
int32_t CSL_patClrIntrPending ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg,
uint32_t  intrSrc 
)

============================================================================
CSL_patClrIntrPending

Description
This function is used to clear the pending status of the specified interrupt source.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure
intrSrc - The interrupt source of type CSL_PatIntrSrc

Return Value
0 - Success
-1 - The specified interrupt source is invalid

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
EXCEPTION_PEND_CLEAR

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };

    CSL_patClrIntrPending(&patCfg, CSL_PAT_INTR_SRC_EXCEPTION);
int32_t CSL_patConfigPageTranslation ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg,
uint64_t  inputAddress,
uint64_t  translatedAddress 
)

============================================================================
CSL_patConfigPageTranslation

Description
This function is used to configure a page address translation for the specified input address using the specified translation address. The translation is automatically enabled after it is configured.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure
inputAddress - The input address to translate
translatedAddress - The translated address to use

Return Value
0 - The page address translation was configured properly
-1 - An error occurred. The specified input address exceeded the page table size.

Pre Condition
CSL_patSetPageSize

Post Condition
None

Writes
BASE_REG_L, BASE_REG_H

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms    patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };
    uint64_t            inputAddress        = 0x00001000UL;
    uint64_t            translatedAddress   = 0x01000000UL;

    CSL_patSetPageSize(&patCfg, CSL_PAT_PAGE_SIZE_4KB);
    CSL_patConfigPageTranslation(&patCfg, inputAddress, translatedAddress );
void CSL_patDisableExceptionLogging ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg)

============================================================================
CSL_patDisableExceptionLogging

Description
This function disables the exception logging capability. It also disables the module's exception interrupt signal generation, regardless of whether the exception interrupt source is enabled or disabled.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
EXCEPTION_LOGGING_CONTROL

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };

    CSL_patDisableExceptionLogging(&patCfg);
int32_t CSL_patDisableIntr ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg,
uint32_t  intrSrc 
)

============================================================================
CSL_patDisableIntr

Description
This function disables the specified interrupt source. This prevents the module's exception interrupt signal from being asserted. Note that software can still call CSL_patIsIntrPending to poll for an exception event and call CSL_patGetExceptionInfo to read exception event information if exception logging is enabled.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure
intrSrc - The interrupt source of type CSL_PatIntrSrc

Return Value
0 - Success
-1 - The specified interrupt source is invalid

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
EXCEPTION_ENABLE_CLEAR

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };

    CSL_patDisableIntr(&patCfg, CSL_PAT_INTR_SRC_EXCEPTION);
int32_t CSL_patDisablePageTranslation ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg,
uint64_t  inputAddress 
)

============================================================================
CSL_patDisablePageTranslation

Description
This function disables page address translation for the page corresponding to the specified input address.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure
inputAddress - The input address

Return Value
0 - The page was enabled properly
-1 - An error occurred. The specified input address exceeded the page table size.

Pre Condition
CSL_patSetPageSize

Post Condition
None

Writes
BASE_REG_H

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms    patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };
    uint64_t            inputAddress = 0x00001000UL;

    CSL_patSetPageSize(&patCfg, CSL_PAT_PAGE_SIZE_4KB);
    CSL_patDisablePageTranslation(&patCfg, inputAddress);
void CSL_patDisablePat ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg)

============================================================================
CSL_patDisablePat

Description
This function disables the page address translation function. When disabled, the page translation table SRAM can be used as general scratch memory.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CONTROL

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };

    CSL_patDisablePat(&patCfg);
void CSL_patEnableExceptionLogging ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg)

============================================================================
CSL_patEnableExceptionLogging

Description
This function enables the exception logging capability. It also enables exception interrupt generation. The module's exception interrupt signal is asserted if the exception logging capability is enabled and the exception interrupt source is enabled by calling the CSL_patEnableIntr function.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
EXCEPTION_LOGGING_CONTROL

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };

    CSL_patEnableExceptionLogging(&patCfg);
int32_t CSL_patEnableIntr ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg,
uint32_t  intrSrc 
)

============================================================================
CSL_patEnableIntr

Description
This function enables the specified interrupt source.

If intrSrc == CSL_PAT_INTR_SRC_EXCEPTION, then this function also calls CSL_patEnableExceptionLogging to enable exception logging as there is no valid reason to enable the exception interrupt source and not log the exception information and assert the module's exception interrupt signal.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure
intrSrc - The interrupt source of type CSL_PatIntrSrc

Return Value
0 - Success
-1 - The specified interrupt source is invalid

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
EXCEPTION_ENABLE_SET

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };

    CSL_patEnableIntr(&patCfg, CSL_PAT_INTR_SRC_EXCEPTION);
    CSL_patDisableIntr(&patCfg, CSL_PAT_INTR_SRC_EXCEPTION);
int32_t CSL_patEnablePageTranslation ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg,
uint64_t  inputAddress 
)

============================================================================
CSL_patEnablePageTranslation

Description
This function enables page address translation for the page corresponding to the specified input address.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure
inputAddress - The input address

Return Value
0 - The page was enabled properly
-1 - An error occurred. The specified input address exceeded the page table size.

Pre Condition
CSL_patSetPageSize

Post Condition
None

Writes
BASE_REG_H

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms    patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };
    uint64_t            inputAddress = 0x00001000UL;

    CSL_patSetPageSize(&patCfg, CSL_PAT_PAGE_SIZE_4KB);
    CSL_patEnablePageTranslation(&patCfg, inputAddress);
void CSL_patEnablePat ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg)

============================================================================
CSL_patEnablePat

Description
This function enables the page address translation function. When enabled, input addresses are translated via page translation table entries.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CONTROL

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };

    CSL_patEnablePat(&patCfg);
uint32_t CSL_patGetArbitrationMode ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg)

============================================================================
CSL_patGetArbitrationMode

Description
This function returns the arbitration mode currently configured for PAT translation table updates and look-ups.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure

Return Value
Currently configured arbitration mode of type CSL_PatArbitrationMode

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Reads
CONTROL

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms            patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };
    uint32_t  arbMode;

    arbMode = CSL_patGetArbitrationMode(&patCfg);
int32_t CSL_patGetExceptionInfo ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg,
CSL_PatExceptionInfo *  pExceptionInfo 
)

============================================================================
CSL_patGetExceptionInfo

Description
This function is used to get information for the last boundary crossing transaction exception captured. The log is automatically cleared by this function so that a future exception can be captured.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure
pExceptionInfo - A pointer to a CSL_PatExceptionInfo structure containing returned exception information

Return Value
0 - Success
-1 - Automatic clearing of the log failed

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Reads
EXCEPTION_LOGGING_HEADER0, EXCEPTION_LOGGING_HEADER1, EXCEPTION_LOGGING_DATA0, EXCEPTION_LOGGING_DATA1, EXCEPTION_LOGGING_DATA2, EXCEPTION_LOGGING_DATA3

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms    patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };
    CSL_PatExceptionInfo ExceptionInfo;

    CSL_patGetExceptionInfo(&patCfg, &ExceptionInfo);
uint32_t CSL_patGetMaxPages ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg)

============================================================================
CSL_patGetMaxPages

Description
This function returns the maximum number of pages that can be configured for this PAT.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure

Return Value
The maximum number of pages that can be configured

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Reads
None

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };
    uint32_t MaxPages;

    MaxPages = CSL_patGetMaxPages(&patCfg);
uint32_t CSL_patGetPageSize ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg)

============================================================================
CSL_patGetPageSize

Description
This function returns the page size currently configured.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure

Return Value
The page size of type CSL_PatPageSize

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Reads
CONTROL

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms      patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };
    uint32_t pageSize;

    pageSize = CSL_patGetPageSize(&patCfg);
uint32_t CSL_patGetRevision ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg)

============================================================================
CSL_patGetRevision

Description
This function returns the revision information for the PAT.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure

Return Value
Revision information. See design specification for details.

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Reads
PID

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };
    uint32_t rev;

    rev = CSL_patGetRevision(&patCfg);
uint32_t CSL_patIsIntrPending ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg,
uint32_t  intrSrc 
)

============================================================================
CSL_patIsIntrPending

Description
This function returns the pending interrupt status of the specified interrupt source.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure
intrSrc - The interrupt source of type CSL_PatIntrSrc

Return Value
true - An interrupt of the specified source is pending
false - An interrupt of the specified source is not pending

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Reads
EXCEPTION_PEND_SET

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };
    uint32_t bIntPending;

    bIntPending = CSL_patIsIntrPending(&patCfg, CSL_PAT_INTR_SRC_EXCEPTION);
    printf("Exception interrupt is %s\n", bIntPending ? "pending" : "not pending" );
int32_t CSL_patSetArbitrationMode ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg,
uint32_t  arbitrationMode 
)

============================================================================
CSL_patSetArbitrationMode

Description
This function configures the arbitration mode for PAT translation table updates and look-ups.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure
arbitrationMode - The desired arbitration mode of type CSL_PatArbitrationMode

Return Value
0 - Success
-1 - The specified arbitration mode is invalid

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CONTROL

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms      patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };
    uint32_t arbMode = CSL_PAT_ARBITRATION_MODE_UPDATES_FIRST;

    CSL_patSetArbitrationMode(&patCfg, arbMode );
void CSL_patSetErrMsgDestId ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg,
uint32_t  destId 
)

============================================================================
CSL_patSetErrMsgDestId

Description
This function is used to set the destination ID for error messages.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure
destId - The destination ID for future error messages

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
DESTINATION_ID

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms  patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };
    uint32_t       destId = 0;

    CSL_patSetErrMsgDestId(&patCfg, destId);
void CSL_patSetExceptionLoggingEnable ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg,
uint32_t  bEnable 
)

============================================================================
CSL_patSetExceptionLoggingEnable

Description
This function enables or disables the exception logging capability.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure
bEnable - If true, the exception logging capability is enabled. If false, it is disabled.

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
EXCEPTION_LOGGING_CONTROL

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };

    CSL_patSetExceptionLoggingEnable(&patCfg, true);
    CSL_patSetExceptionLoggingEnable(&patCfg, false);
int32_t CSL_patSetIntrEnable ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg,
uint32_t  intrSrc,
uint32_t  bEnable 
)

============================================================================
CSL_patSetIntrEnable

Description
This function enables or disables the interrupt for the specified interrupt source.

If intrSrc == CSL_PAT_INTR_SRC_EXCEPTION and bEnable != 0, then this function also calls CSL_patEnableExceptionLogging to enable exception logging as there is no valid reason to enable the exception interrupt source and not log the exception information and assert the module's exception interrupt signal.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure
intrSrc - The interrupt source of type CSL_PatIntrSrc
bEnable - If true, the interrupt for the specified interrupt source is enabled. If false, it is disabled.

Return Value
0 - Success
-1 - The specified interrupt source is invalid

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
EXCEPTION_ENABLE_SET

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };

    CSL_patSetIntrEnable(&patCfg, CSL_PAT_INTR_SRC_EXCEPTION, true);
    CSL_patSetIntrEnable(&patCfg, CSL_PAT_INTR_SRC_EXCEPTION, false);
int32_t CSL_patSetIntrPending ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg,
uint32_t  intrSrc 
)

============================================================================
CSL_patSetIntrPending

Description
This function is used to forceably set the pending status of the specified interrupt source.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure
intrSrc - The interrupt source of type CSL_PatIntrSrc

Return Value
0 - Success
-1 - The specified interrupt source is invalid

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
EXCEPTION_PEND_SET

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };

    CSL_patSetIntrPending(&patCfg, CSL_PAT_INTR_SRC_EXCEPTION);
int32_t CSL_patSetPageSize ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg,
uint32_t  pageSize 
)

============================================================================
CSL_patSetPageSize

Description
This function configures the page size.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure
pageSize - The page size of type CSL_PatPageSize

Return Value
0 - The specified page size was set successfully
-1 - The specified page size is invalid

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Reads
CONTROL

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms      patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };

    CSL_patSetPageSize(&patCfg, CSL_PAT_PAGE_SIZE_16KB);
int32_t CSL_patSetPageTranslationEnable ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg,
uint64_t  inputAddress,
uint32_t  bEnable 
)

============================================================================
CSL_patSetPageTranslationEnable

Description
This function enables or disables page address translation for the page corresponding to the specified input address.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure
inputAddress - The input address
bEnable - If true, the page address translation for the page corresponding to the specified input address is enabled. If false, it is disabled.

Return Value
0 - The page was enabled properly
-1 - An error occurred. The specified input address exceeded the page table size.

Pre Condition
CSL_patSetPageSize

Post Condition
None

Writes
BASE_REG_H

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms    patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };
    uint64_t            inputAddress = 0x00001000UL;

    CSL_patSetPageSize(&patCfg, CSL_PAT_PAGE_SIZE_4KB);
    CSL_patSetPageTranslationEnable(&patCfg, inputAddress, true);
    CSL_patSetPageTranslationEnable(&patCfg, inputAddress, false);
void CSL_patSetPatEnable ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg,
uint32_t  bEnable 
)

============================================================================
CSL_patSetPatEnable

Description
This function enables or disables the page address translation function. When enabled, input addresses are translated via page translation table entries.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure
bEnable - If true, the page address translation function is enabled. If false, it is disabled.

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CONTROL

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };

    CSL_patSetPatEnable(&patCfg, true);
    CSL_patSetPatEnable(&patCfg, false);
void CSL_patSetReplaceOrderIdEnable ( const CSL_PatConfigParms *  pPatCfg,
uint32_t  bEnable 
)

============================================================================
CSL_patSetReplaceOrderIdEnable

Description
This function enables or disables the replace orderid feature allowing a hypervisor or OS to globally disable the feature if applications or VM's should not be able to modify orderid values. The page based enables are used if globally enabled and are always ignored if globally disabled.

Arguments
pPatCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_PatConfigParms*) to the PAT configuration structure
bEnable - If not 0, the replace orderid feature is enabled. If 0, it is disabled.

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
CONTROL

Example 

    CSL_PatConfigParms patCfg = { (CSL_patRegs *)PAT_BASE_ADDRESS, (CSL_pat_tableRegs *)PAT_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS };

    CSL_patSetReplaceOrderIdEnable(&patCfg, true);
    CSL_patSetReplaceOrderIdEnable(&patCfg, false);
